column4: do i need X to upgrade version? i get error on 'update-manager -d'
you can use apt-get and do it yourself, if you know what youre doing
sure. what should i do? change list.sources?
yes, for one.... and run sudo apt-get dist-upgrade
works. thank you!
thank me once all done ;)
i need to upgrade twice. from 8.04 to 8.10 to 9.04...
really dont know.
i wasn't asking a question. just stated a fact..i need to upgrade twice.
good to know :)
it finishes downloading 40 MB, but i still have 8.04. maybe there is another command i need to run or change some stuff in sources.list to upgrade it?
did u reboot?
no. didn't reboot.
it only download 40MB, r u sure it's ok?
i always thought i neeed to change some stuff in sources.list
you do. 1. Chage sources.list, 2 apt-get update, 3 dist-upgrade
mmm. ok. do i need to change all entries in sources.list?
ok
ok
138MB of download. thanks!
